edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.design
Class Design

java.lang.Object
  edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.design.Design
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Design
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The design class houses an entire XDL design or hard macro. It keeps track of all of its member instances, nets, modules and attributes and can load/import save/export XDL files. When an XDL design is loaded into this class it also populates the Device and WireEnumerator classes that correspond to the part this design targets.

Author:
Chris Lavin Created on: Jun 22, 2010
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Design

public Design()
Constructor which initializes all member data structures. Sets partName to null. NCDVersion is set to null. isHardMacro is set to false.

Method Detail

loadDeviceAndWireEnumerator

public void loadDeviceAndWireEnumerator()
Loads the corresponding Device and WireEnumerator based on partName.

isPrimitiveSiteUsed

public boolean isPrimitiveSiteUsed(PrimitiveSite site)
Checks if the primitive site site is used in this design.

Parameters:
site - The site to check for.
Returns:
True if this design uses site, false otherwise.

setPrimitiveSiteUsed

protected Instance setPrimitiveSiteUsed(PrimitiveSite site,
                                        Instance inst)
Marks a primitive site as used by a particular instance.

Parameters:
site - The site to be marked as used.
inst - The instance using the site.

releasePrimitiveSite

protected Instance releasePrimitiveSite(PrimitiveSite site)

getInstanceAtPrimitiveSite

public Instance getInstanceAtPrimitiveSite(PrimitiveSite site)
Gets and returns the instance which resides at site.

Parameters:
site - The site of the desired instance.
Returns:
The instance at site, or null if the primitive site is unoccupied.

addInstanceToModuleInstances

public ModuleInstance addInstanceToModuleInstances(Instance inst,
                                                   java.lang.String moduleInstanceName)
Hard macro instances do not have a unified container, so we use a HashMap. This function allows the separation of an instance based on its hard macro instance name.

Parameters:
inst - The instance to add to the hashMap
Returns:
The ModuleInstance that the instance was added to

getModuleInstance

public ModuleInstance getModuleInstance(java.lang.String name)
Gets and returns the moduleInstance called name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the moduleInstance to get.
Returns:
The moduleInstance name, or null if it does not exist.

createModuleInstance

public ModuleInstance createModuleInstance(java.lang.String name,
                                           Module module)
Creates, adds to design, and returns a new ModuleInstance called name and based on module. The module is also added to the design if not already present.

Parameters:
name - The name of the new ModuleInstance created.
module - The Module that the new ModuleInstance instances.
Returns:
A new ModuleInstance

hasAttribute

public boolean hasAttribute(java.lang.String physicalName)
Checks if the design attribute has an attribute with a physical name called phyisicalName.

Parameters:
physicalName - The physical name of the attribute to check for.
Returns:
True if the design contains an attribute with the physical name physicalName, false otherwise.

Returns:
The HashMap containing all current module instances.

public java.lang.String getPartName()
This will return the part name with speed grade of the part this design or hard macro targets (ex: xc4vsx35ff668-10).

Returns:
The part name with package and speed grade information.

The NCD version string.

True if this design is a hard macro, false otherwise.

getHardMacro

public Module getHardMacro()
Gets the core module that corresponds to this class if it is a hard macro (a hard macro design will have only one module).

Returns:
The module of the hard macro, null if this is not a hard macro design.

The wire enumerator for this part.

setWireEnumerator

public void setWireEnumerator(WireEnumerator we)
Sets the WireEnumerator for this design.

Parameters:
we - The WireEnumerator to set for this design.

getDevice

public Device getDevice()
Gets the device specific to this part and returns it. (This should be the same device loaded with the XDL design file).

Returns:
The device specific to this part.

setName

public void setName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the name of the design

Parameters:
name - New name for the design

setDevice

public void setDevice(Device dev)
Sets the device specific to this part. Generally only used by the parser when loading a design, but could be used to convert a design to a different part (among a host of other transformations).

Parameters:
dev - The device to set this design with.

setPartName

public void setPartName(java.lang.String partName)
Sets the Xilinx part name, it should include package and speed grade also. For example xc4vfx12ff668-10 is a valid part name.

Parameters:
partName - Name of the Xilinx FPGA part.

setNCDVersion

public void setNCDVersion(java.lang.String ver)
Sets the NCD version as shown in the XDL file.

Parameters:
ver - The NCD version.

setIsHardMacro

public void setIsHardMacro(boolean value)
Sets the design as a hard macro or not (a hard macro will have only one module as a member of the design).

Parameters:
value - true if it is a hard macro, false otherwise.

setNets

public void setNets(java.util.ArrayList<Net> netList)
Sets the nets of the design from the ArrayList netList.

Parameters:
netList - The new list of nets to replace the current nets of the design.

unrouteDesign

public void unrouteDesign()
Unroutes the current design by removing all PIPs.

loadXDLFile

public void loadXDLFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Load a standard XDL file and return the XDL_Design object.

Parameters:
fileName - The name of the xdl file to load.

saveXDLFile

public void saveXDLFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Saves the XDL design to a minimalist XDL file. This is the same as saveXDLFile(fileName, false);

Parameters:
fileName - Name of the file to save the design to.

saveXDLFile

public void saveXDLFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                        boolean addComments)
Saves the XDL design and adds comments based on the parameter addComments.

Parameters:
fileName - Name of the file to save the design to.
addComments - Adds the same comments found in XDL designs created by the Xilinx xdl tool.
